author: mcDingleHead
body:

## Steps to reproduce

PS C:\> enter-pssession -computername localhost -configurationname PowerShell.7.1.0-rc.1

[localhost]: PS C:\> invoke-webrequest http://www.google.com

Error: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Net.Connections, Version=5.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'. The system cannot find the file specified.


## Expected behavior

I'd expect invoke-webrequest to return the contents of the web page.

## Actual behavior

Instead, I receive:

Error: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Net.Connections, Version=5.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a'. The system cannot find the file specified.

## Environment data

The problem only occurs when running in a remote session. That's why I ran enter-pssession localhost prior to executing the invoke-webrequest command.

The issue began when PowerShell.7.1.0-rc.1 was installed. It's not an issue in the prior version (7.1.0-preview.7).

Installing .NET 5.0 RC1 doesn't resolve the issue.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: /cc @PaulHigin @SteveL-MSFT unsure if this is an issue in the remoting systems or it's something .NET introduced, but either we need to alert them or figure out if there's something we need to be doing for .NET 5 that we didn't need to previously?

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body:
@mcDingleHead Please provide some additional diagnostics info that may be helpful:
1) `$PSVersionTable` from both: local and remote sessions.
2) how did you deploy `7.1.0-rc.1` - from archive (zip/tar.gz) or using installer package (msi/deb/rpm) ?
3) looks like there were previous PS Core installations, when you installed `7.1.0-rc.1`, correct?
